page.title: 03LONGHURST NURSERY WHITTON
page.content: Longhurst Nursery has stood for over 300 years. There have been three owners as far as I know. It used to be owned by Mr Longhurst but in 1900 Mr J.Bowman bought it for Â£2000. In 1972 Mr P.Bowman his son took it over and he is the present owner. The name of the nursery would have been changed but it was so well known as Longhurst that it kept that name. The nursery is 20 acres in size. Vegetables used to grow there but now all the vegetables are bought from Western International Market. The nursery grows and sells lots of flowers. Cows are now kept on the field so they dont grow corn in the field. The railway track backs right onto the farm so does Heathfield Rec. Before it became a nursery it was a farm where shire horses were used.Now tractors are used BISHOP PERRIN SCHOOL
